title: 107_hr2558
content: The Act titled "Teacher Voluntary Early Retirement Incentive Act of 2001" allows for voluntary early retirement incentive plans for governmental and higher education employees. The Age Discrimination in Employment Act of 1967 is amended to allow voluntary retirement incentive plans for educational agency and higher education employees, with age-based benefits reductions permitted only for supplemental benefits. The Age Discrimination in Employment Act of 1967 is amended to allow voluntary retirement incentive plans for educational agency and higher education employees. Age-based benefits reductions are only permitted for supplemental benefits, with specific conditions for eligibility and timing of retirement elections. The Age Discrimination in Employment Act of 1967 is amended to allow voluntary retirement incentive plans for educational agency and higher education employees, with specific conditions for eligibility and timing of retirement elections. The Age Discrimination in Employment Act of 1967 was amended to permit voluntary retirement incentive plans for educational agency and higher education employees, with conditions for eligibility and timing of retirement elections. The plan's compliance with the Act's provisions was assessed after January 1, 1996. SEC. 3. Retiree medical benefits coordinated with Medicare and other governmental and employer benefit plans; voluntary early retirement incentive plans maintained by local educational agencies. (a) Voluntary Early Retirement Incentive Plans Maintained by Local Educational Agencies.--Section 4(l)(1) of the Age Discrimination in Employment Act of 1967 is amended to include voluntary early retirement plans maintained by local educational agencies in coordination with defined benefit plans. (b) Retiree Medical Benefits Coordinated With Medicare Benefits.--Section 4(l) of the Act is amended to clarify that it is not a violation for an employee benefit plan to coordinate retiree medical benefits with Medicare benefits. Section 4(l) of the Age Discrimination in Employment Act of 1967 is amended to allow for alterations, reductions, or eliminations of medical benefits for retired participants when they are eligible for Medicare benefits. The amendments also apply to voluntary early retirement plans maintained by local educational agencies and employee benefit plans providing medical benefits for retired participants. Section 14101 of the Elementary and Secondary Education Act states that any violation of the Age Discrimination in Employment Act of 1967 after January 1, 1996, regarding employee benefit plans providing medical benefits for retired participants is prohibited. The amendment made by subsection (a) does not determine if a voluntary early retirement incentive plan constitutes a defined benefit plan for any purpose.
